description.main: At WorkerHomes, we understand that finding the right accommodation can be challenging, especially workers on the move. That's why we've created a platform dedicated to connecting workers, businesses, and property owners, making it easier than ever to find and offer comfortable, affordable, and convenient housing solutions.
description.who: WorkerHomes was founded with a simple yet powerful mission: to streamline the process of finding and providing temporary housing for traveling workers. Whether you're a contractor, project manager, or property owner, our platform is designed to cater to your specific needs. With years of experience in the housing and rental industry, our team is passionate about creating a community where finding accommodation is quick, easy, and stress-free.
description.vision: We envision a world where every worker, regardless of location, has access to quality accommodation that suits their needs. Our goal is to be the go-to platform for temporary housing, offering an extensive network of listings across various regions. We aim to make the housing search process as seamless as possible, empowering workers to focus on their jobs without worrying about where they'll stay.
description.community: Whether you're looking for a place to stay or have a property to list, WorkerHomes is here to help. Join our growing community of workers and property owners who trust us to make their housing search simple, reliable, and efficient.
description.connect: Start exploring WorkerHomes today and discover the easiest way to find temporary housing that feels like home.

1.title: Simplicity
1.description: We believe in keeping things simple. Our user-friendly platform ensures that both listing and finding accommodations are hassle-free.

2.title: Trust
2.description: Trust is at the core of everything we do. We carefully vet our listings and strive to create a community where users feel confident in their choices.

3.title: Accessibility
3.description: We're committed to making housing accessible to everyone. From small towns to bustling cities, our platform covers a wide range of locations to meet diverse needs.

4.title: Community
4.description: We're more than just a platform‚Äîwe're a community. We connect workers with property owners, fostering relationships that benefit everyone involved.

1.title: Extensive Listings
1.description: Whether you need a place for a few days, weeks, or several months, WorkerHomes has you covered. Our platform features a wide variety of properties, from single rooms to entire homes, across multiple regions.

2.title: Easy-to-Use Platform
2.description: Our website is designed with you in mind. Quickly browse through listings, filter by your specific needs, and connect directly with property owners.

3.title: Flexible Solutions
3.description: We understand that work schedules can change, so we offer flexible rental options that cater to both short-term and long-term stays.

1.title: Tailored for Workers
1.description: Unlike generic rental platforms, WorkerHomes is specifically designed to meet the needs of traveling workers and the businesses that support them.

2.title: Reliable Listings
2.description: We work closely with property owners to ensure that every listing on our site meets our high standards for quality and reliability.

3.title: Affordable Options
3.description: We offer a range of pricing options to fit every budget, making it easier to find a comfortable place to stay without breaking the bank.

4.title: Growing Network
4.description: Our network of listings is constantly expanding, giving you more choices and flexibility when it comes to finding the perfect accommodation.

sidebar.2: Collection and Storage of Personal Data
sidebar.5: Disclosure of Data to Third Parties

description.main: Your privacy is important to us. This Privacy Policy explains how WorkerHomes collects, processes, and uses your personal data when you use our website and services. Please read this policy carefully to understand how we handle your data.

1.text: The data controller responsible for processing your personal data on this website is:

2.text: We collect and store personal data only as permitted by law. This occurs in the following situations:

1.title: When Registering:
1.description: When you register on our platform, we collect data such as your name, email address, address, and, if applicable, payment information.

2.title: When Using the Platform:
2.description: While using the platform, we may collect information about your activities, including the listings you create and your interactions with other users.

3.title: Technical Data:
3.description: When you visit our website, data is automatically collected by your browser, such as your IP address, browser type, operating system, and access times.

3.text: Your personal data is processed for the following purposes:

1.title: Providing Services:
1.description: To enable you to access the platform and use our services.

2.title: Contract Fulfillment:
2.description: To fulfill our contractual obligations, such as processing your payments or managing your listings.

3.title: Communication:
3.description: To contact you, such as to inform you about changes to our services or this Privacy Policy.

4.title: Website Optimization:
4.description: To improve the functionality and user-friendliness of our website.

5.title: Legal Obligations:
5.description: To comply with legal requirements, such as the retention of invoices and accounting records.

4.text: The processing of your personal data is based on the following legal grounds:

1.title: Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (Contract Performance):
1.description: Processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which you are a party or to take steps at your request prior to entering into a contract.

2.title: Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR (Consent):
2.description: If you have given us consent to process your data for specific purposes, the processing is based on your consent.

3.title: Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (Legitimate Interests):
3.description: Processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by us, provided that your interests or fundamental rights and freedoms do not override these interests.

4.title: Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR (Legal Obligations):
4.description: Processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which we are subject.

5.text: Your personal data will only be disclosed to third parties if permitted by law or if you have given your explicit consent. This may occur in the following cases:

1.title: Payment Processing:
1.description: We work with external payment service providers to process payments, and your payment data will be transmitted to them.

2.title: Service Providers:
2.description: We engage external service providers to perform certain services, such as IT services, hosting, or marketing. These providers are contractually obligated to treat your data confidentially and to process it only as part of the agreed service.

3.title: Legal Obligations:
3.description: If we are legally obliged to do so, we will disclose your data to authorities or other government entities.

6.text: Your personal data will only be retained as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected or as required by law. After the relevant periods have expired, the data will be deleted or anonymized.

7.text: You have the following rights regarding your personal data:
7.text2: To exercise these rights, you can contact us at any time.

1.title: Access:
1.description: You can request information about the personal data we hold about you at any time.

2.title: Rectification:
2.description: You can request the correction of inaccurate data or the completion of incomplete data.

3.title: Erasure:
3.description: You can request the deletion of your personal data if it is no longer necessary for the fulfillment of a contract, the assertion, exercise, or defense of legal claims, or compliance with legal obligations.

4.title: Restriction of Processing:
4.description: You can request the restriction of the processing of your personal data if the accuracy of the data is disputed, the processing is unlawful, but you oppose the erasure, or we no longer need the data, but you require it for the establishment, exercise, or defense of legal claims.

5.title: Data Portability:
5.description: You have the right to receive the personal data concerning you that you have provided to us in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format and to request the transfer of this data to another controller.

6.title: Withdrawal of Consent:
6.description: You can withdraw your consent at any time with effect for the future.

7.title: Objection:
7.description: You can object to the processing of your personal data if there are reasons arising from your particular situation that speak against the data processing.

8.text: We implement technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, loss, or destruction. Our security measures are continuously improved in line with technological developments.

9.text: Our website uses cookies to facilitate the use of our website and to provide certain features. Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device. Some of the cookies we use are deleted at the end of the browser session, while others remain on your device and allow us to recognize your browser on your next visit.
9.text2: You can adjust your cookie settings at any time and object to the use of certain cookies. However, disabling cookies may limit the functionality of our website.

10.text: We reserve the right to change this Privacy Policy at any time to adapt it to new legal situations or changes to our service or data processing. The current version is available on our website.

11.text: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or the processing of your personal data, you can contact us at the following details:

description.main: Welcome to WorkerHomes. These Terms and Conditions ('Terms') govern the use of our platform, where accommodations for rent can be listed and found. Please read these Terms carefully before using our services. By using our platform, you agree to these Terms. If you do not agree, you may not use the platform.
description.1: These Terms apply to the use of the WorkerHomes website and all associated services and content. They govern the relationship between WorkerHomes and the users of the platform, including both accommodation providers ('Providers') and seekers ('Users').
description.2: WorkerHomes offers a platform where Providers can list their accommodations for rent and Users can view these listings. WorkerHomes provides only a directory service. No direct booking or payment processing takes place through the platform.

1.title: Registration Requirement:
1.description: To access all the platform's features, Users must register and create an account. Registration is free of charge.

2.title: Information:
2.description: Users are required to provide truthful and complete information during registration and promptly update this information in the event of changes.

3.title: Responsibility:
3.description: The User is responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of their password and for all activities that occur under their account.

1.title: Listing Description:
1.description: Providers must ensure that their accommodation descriptions are accurate, complete, and up to date. All relevant information, including prices, availability, and conditions, must be provided.

2.title: Legal Compliance:
2.description: Providers are responsible for ensuring that their listings comply with applicable laws, regulations, and requirements, including local rental regulations.

3.title: Use of Information:
3.description: WorkerHomes is not liable for the accuracy of the information provided by Providers. The use of the platform is at the User's own risk.

4.title: Listing Descriptions:
4.description: Users are required to accurately and fully describe their listings. Listings that do not constitute a genuine offer but are intended solely to attract the attention of potential customers, or posts containing offensive or otherwise illegal content, will be considered abuse and will be deactivated or deleted by WorkerHomes without prior notice.

1.title: Free Use:
1.description: The basic features of the platform are free of charge. There are no fees for creating and displaying listings.

2.title: Paid Services:
2.description: WorkerHomes reserves the right to offer paid additional services in the future. These will only be provided with the User's express consent.

3.title: Pricing and Billing:
3.description: All prices are exclusive of VAT. WorkerHomes will issue invoices to paying customers by email only. Additionally, all invoices are available for download in the User Dashboard.

1.title: Content on the Platform:
1.description: WorkerHomes provides the platform 'as is' and 'as available.' No warranty is given for the accuracy, completeness, or timeliness of the content.

2.title: Liability Disclaimer:
2.description: WorkerHomes, its legal representatives, and its vicarious agents are only liable for intentional or grossly negligent conduct. For essential contractual obligations (i.e., obligations that are crucial for achieving the purpose of the contract), liability extends to slight negligence, but is limited to the foreseeable, contract-typical, direct average damage. For entrepreneurs, WorkerHomes is liable in the case of grossly negligent breaches of non-essential contractual obligations only to the extent of the foreseeable, contract-typical, direct average damage.

description.7: The above disclaimer does not apply to liability for damages resulting from injury to life, body, or health. The provisions of the Product Liability Act remain unaffected by the disclaimer.

8.text: Users may not use the platform for illegal or unauthorized purposes. This includes:

1.title: Abuse:
1.description: Users are prohibited from using the platform for illegal activities, including but not limited to fraud, money laundering, or the dissemination of illegal content.

2.title: Data Protection:
2.description: The use of the platform must comply with applicable data protection laws. It is prohibited to collect, store, or share personal data of other Users without their consent.

1.title: Termination by WorkerHomes:
1.description: WorkerHomes reserves the right to suspend or delete a User's account at any time and without giving reasons, especially in the event of violations of these Terms or misuse of the platform. In such cases, the User is not entitled to a refund of any fees paid. WorkerHomes may terminate the contract with one month's notice. WorkerHomes also reserves the right to delete user accounts that have been inactive for more than 12 months.

2.title: Termination by the User:
2.description: Users can cancel their monthly subscription at any time via their user account. The cancellation will take effect at the end of the current billing period. No partial refund will be given for the current month. After cancellation, access to paid features will remain available until the end of the current billing period, after which the User will revert to a free account.

3.title: Subscription Term and Termination:
3.description: The term for paid packages is 1 month. The right to terminate for cause without notice remains unaffected. Unless the package is canceled before the end of the contract term, it will automatically renew for the selected term. The User can cancel the contract at any time using the cancellation button. The account will remain active until the end of the current package term or trial period and can still be used by the User during this time. The current billing period must still be paid by the User. WorkerHomes may terminate the contract at any time at the end of the respective contract term.

4.title: Right of Withdrawal in Accordance with Directive 2011/83/EU:

list.1: Consumers have the right to withdraw from their contract within 14 days without giving any reason (Right of Withdrawal).
list.2: To exercise your right of withdrawal, you must inform us by means of a clear statement (e.g., by email or post) of your decision to withdraw from this contract. To meet the withdrawal deadline, it is sufficient for you to send your communication concerning your exercise of the right of withdrawal before the withdrawal period has expired.
list.3: Expiry of the Right of Withdrawal: The right of withdrawal expires in accordance with Article 16 of Directive 2011/83/EU when the service has been fully performed or, in cases where the service begins during the withdrawal period, when you have expressly agreed that the execution of the service begins and you have acknowledged that you will lose your right of withdrawal once the service has started.
list.4: As the service on WorkerHomes begins with the publication of your listing, your right of withdrawal expires as soon as your listing is published and you have agreed to the start of the service.

description.10: WorkerHomes implements effective data backups as part of its service provision, but does not provide a general data backup guarantee for the data submitted by the User. The User is also responsible for creating regular backups of their data to prevent data loss. WorkerHomes will exercise the appropriate level of care in delivering the agreed service and will perform data backups with the necessary expertise. However, WorkerHomes does not guarantee that the stored content or data accessed by the User will not be accidentally damaged, corrupted, lost, or partially removed. It is the User's responsibility to take their own precautions to secure their data.
description.11: The WorkerHomes website contains content primarily uploaded by Users. WorkerHomes will remove content if there are indications that these Terms, applicable laws, or the rights of third parties have been violated. Regarding content uploaded by third parties, WorkerHomes acts merely as a service provider in accordance with ¬ß 10 TMG (Telemedia Act). Rights holders, particularly those with copyrights and industrial property rights, can report infringing content and request its removal. WorkerHomes does not guarantee or assume liability for the accuracy of the content posted on the website by third parties.
description.12: For the content (images, listing descriptions) that the User uploads to WorkerHomes, the User grants WorkerHomes a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, unlimited, transferable, and irrevocable right of use in all known forms of use regarding all copyrights and other protective rights. The User undertakes to only upload content for which they can grant such rights to WorkerHomes.
description.13: The User shall indemnify WorkerHomes against all claims asserted by third parties against WorkerHomes due to such violations. This also includes the reimbursement of necessary legal defense costs. The User undertakes to hold WorkerHomes harmless in the event of a claim.
description.14: WorkerHomes and its legal representatives and vicarious agents are only liable for intentional or gross negligence. For essential contractual obligations (i.e., obligations that are crucial for achieving the purpose of the contract), liability extends to slight negligence but is limited to the foreseeable, contract-typical, direct average damage. For entrepreneurs, WorkerHomes is liable in the case of grossly negligent breaches of non-essential contractual obligations only to the extent of the foreseeable, contract-typical, direct average damage.
description.15: The above disclaimer does not apply to liability for damages resulting from injury to life, body, or health. The provisions of the Product Liability Act remain unaffected by the disclaimer.
description.16: Unless mandatory legal provisions under the customer's home country‚Äôs law prevail, German law shall apply, excluding the UN Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods (CISG).
description.17: Should any provision of these Terms be wholly or partially invalid, this shall not affect the validity of the remaining provisions. In place of the invalid provision, a provision shall apply that comes as close as possible to the economic purpose of the invalid provision.
